            Communicative English Training

            • by Anbarasi
            • English
            • (55 Rating)

            Course Description

            This dynamic course is designed to improve your speaking and listening skills in real-world situations, helping you feel more confident in conversations.

            Through practical exercises, role-plays, and interactive sessions, you’ll strengthen your ability to communicate fluently in everyday and professional settings.

            What You’ll Learn?
            • Enhance speaking fluency and pronunciation.
            • develop listening skills to understand native speakers with ease.
            • Learn effective communication strategies for social and professional situations.

            By the end of this course, you'll be able to participate confidently in conversations and discussions, both in personal and professional environments.

            Course Curriculum

            The curriculum spans 8 weeks, focusing on key areas of speaking and listening, using real-world scenarios to enhance language skills.

            Week 1: Introduction to Communicative English

            Get familiar with key vocabulary and expressions used in everyday conversations.

            • Common Phrases for Everyday Conversations
            • Building Confidence in Speaking
            • Pronunciation Basics
            Week 2: Asking and Answering Questions

            Master the art of asking and answering questions in various situations.

            • Yes/No Questions
            • Open-Ended Questions
            • Follow-up Questions
            Week 3: Effective Listening Skills

            Learn how to understand and respond to what native speakers are saying.

            • Listening for Key Information
            • Understanding Accents and Varieties
            • Active Listening Techniques
            Week 4: Speaking with Clarity

            develop your speaking skills to sound more natural and clear in conversation.

            • Intonation and Stress
            • Reducing Common Mistakes in Pronunciation
            • Fluency and Speed in Speaking
            Week 5: Social Conversations

            Learn how to participate in casual conversations and small talk.

            • Making Introductions
            • Talking About Hobbies and Interests
            • Talking About the Weather
            Week 6: Expressing Opinions and Ideas

            Gain the confidence to express your thoughts and opinions clearly and politely.

            • Agreeing and Disagreeing Politely
            • Giving and Asking for Opinions
            • Explaining and Clarifying Ideas
            Week 7: Business Communication

            Enhance your communication skills for the workplace.

            • Making Requests and Giving Instructions
            • Participating in Meetings
            • Writing and Speaking for Professional Settings
            Week 8: Final Practice and Review

            Apply everything you've learned in a final review and practice session.

            • Final Speaking Exercise
            • Final Listening Exercise
            • Course Recap and Feedback
            Anbarasi
            English Communication Specialist

            She is an expert in teaching spoken English with over 8 years of experience in helping non-native speakers build confidence in communication.
